office: California Democrat and Member on the Transportation and Infrastructure Committee
requirements: excellent research, writing, and communication skills
strong interpersonal skills and a willingness to work in a team environment
prior legislative experience on Capitol Hill

key_responsibilities: serving as a top advisor on key issues
requirements: at least 5 years of Capitol Hill experience
strong understanding of the legislative process
excellent written and oral communication skills, and editing abilities
ability to manage and mentor staff
experience in formulating strategic plans for advancing legislation

key_responsibilities: staffing the Member for hearings and mark-ups
meeting with constituents and interested groups on behalf of the Member
requirements: strong understanding of the healthcare universe
ability to work well with a team in a small, fast-paced environment

key_responsibilities: management of an active constituent correspondence program
requirements: strong organizational and time management skills

key_responsibilities: establishing and maintaining relationships with Connecticut, national, and D.C.-based media
coordinating all media efforts and communication-related events
drafting and distributing press releases and media advisories
working with digital press assistant to draft, edit and post creative content across all social media platforms
pitching stories to reporters and producers
serving as the point-of-contact for media
monitoring media narratives and identifying opportunities to promote the Member
coordinating and staffing the Congresswoman for interviews and events
working with legislative staff to coordinate E-newsletter
providing weekly reports on communications activities to Member and senior staff
requirements: superior written and oral communications skills

office: Chairman of the Judiciary Subcommittee on Constitution, Civil Rights and Civil Liberties
key_responsibilities: representing the Member at meetings and events
requirements: strong organizational, writing, and communication skills
thorough knowledge of House rules and legislative process
ability to work in a fast-paced environment

key_responsibilities: assisting the Congressman and Chief of Staff in coordinating meetings involving multiple Members of Congress
other administrative and legislative duties as assigned
requirements: safe vehicle and a good driving record

key_responsibilities: managing a very active health care portfolio
Member’s leadership of two high-profile caucuses
requirements: at least three years of experience developing and implementing legislative strategies in a Congressional office
strong research, writing, and negotiation skills
advanced degree in a health field

key_responsibilities: conducting investigations and adjudicatory and disciplinary proceedings regarding Members and staff of the U.S. House of Representatives
requirements: ability to conduct impartial investigations and refrain from political or partisan activity
outstanding analytical and written/oral communications skills

experience in government ethics; criminal law; employment law, including the laws governing sexual harassment in the workplace; civil litigation; administrative investigations and adjudications; depositions; and financial accounting

key_responsibilities: working on issues related to small business agriculture, energy, and trade policy
requirements: demonstrated capacity to generate new ideas
prior Hill, federal agency, private sector, or policy think tank experience

office: The Office of Congressman Ed Case (HI-01)
key_responsibilities: directly assisting the Congressman on various administrative tasks

office: The House Select Committee on the Climate Crisis
key_responsibilities: generating graphics, video and social media content
conceiving, developing and publishing online video and graphics
maintaining the committee’s presence on major social media platforms
requirements: at least two years of experience
participation in climate or other justice-based movements
